documentation:
Amazon Polly is a web service that makes it easy to synthesize speech from text.

The Amazon Polly service provides API operations for synthesizing high-quality speech from plain text and Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML), along with managing pronunciations lexicons that enable you to get the best results for your application domain.

SynthesizeSpeech.name: SynthesizeSpeech

LexiconNames.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply
      during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same
      as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, 
      see <ulink url="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/polly/latest/dg/API_PutLexicon.html">PutLexicon</ulink>.</simpara>
LexiconNames.documentation: List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, see PutLexicon.

OutputFormat.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>
      The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. 
      For speech marks, this will be json.  </simpara>
         <simpara>When pcm is used, the content returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format. </simpara>
OutputFormat.documentation:
The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

When pcm is used, the content returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

SampleRate.zonbookDocumentation: The audio frequency specified in Hz. The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050". Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".
SampleRate.documentation:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".

Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

SpeechMarkTypes.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The type of speech marks returned for the input text.</simpara>
SpeechMarkTypes.documentation: The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

Text.zonbookDocumentation: Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.
Text.documentation: Input text to synthesize. If you specify ssml as the TextType, follow the SSML format for the input text.

TextType.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>
      Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text.
      For more information, see <ulink url="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/polly/latest/dg/ssml.html">Using SSML</ulink>.</simpara>
TextType.documentation: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text. For more information, see Using SSML.

VoiceId.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>
      Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of 
      available voice IDs by calling the <ulink url="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/polly/latest/dg/API_DescribeVoices.html">DescribeVoices</ulink> operation.
    </simpara>
VoiceId.documentation: Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the DescribeVoices operation.

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation: Optional language code for the Synthesize Speech request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN). If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.
LanguageCode.documentation:
Optional language code for the Synthesize Speech request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

ContentType.zonbookDocumentation: Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request. If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg. If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg. If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format. If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.
ContentType.documentation:
Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request.

  • If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg.

  • If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg.

  • If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

  • If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: The value of the "Text" parameter is longer than the accepted limits. For the SynthesizeSpeech API, the limit for input text is a maximum of 6000 characters total, of which no more than 3000 can be billed characters. For the StartSpeechSynthesisTask API, the maximum is 200,000 characters, of which no more than 100,000 can be billed characters. SSML tags are not counted as billed characters.
errors.documentation: The value of the "Text" parameter is longer than the accepted limits. For the SynthesizeSpeech API, the limit for input text is a maximum of 6000 characters total, of which no more than 3000 can be billed characters. For the StartSpeechSynthesisTask API, the maximum is 200,000 characters, of which no more than 100,000 can be billed characters. SSML tags are not counted as billed characters.

errors.documentation: The specified sample rate is not valid.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The SSML you provided is invalid.
      Verify the SSML syntax, spelling of tags and values, and then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The SSML you provided is invalid. Verify the SSML syntax, spelling of tags and values, and then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon.
      This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon
      that is in a different region.</simpara>
         <simpara>Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see <xref linkend="ListLexicons"/>) 
      and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.

Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: Speech marks are not supported for the OutputFormat selected. Speech marks are only available for content in json format.
errors.documentation: Speech marks are not supported for the OutputFormat selected. Speech marks are only available for content in json format.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>SSML speech marks are not supported for plain text-type input.</simpara>
errors.documentation: SSML speech marks are not supported for plain text-type input.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <para>The language specified is not currently supported by Amazon Polly in this capacity.</para>
errors.documentation: The language specified is not currently supported by Amazon Polly in this capacity.

SynthesizeSpeech.documentation: Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.

ContentType.zonbookDocumentation: Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request. If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg. If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg. If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format. If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.
ContentType.documentation:
Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request.

  • If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg.

  • If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg.

  • If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

  • If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.

<para>List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service 
      to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language 
      of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. </para>

<para>The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For 
      audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech
      marks, this will be json. </para>
OutputFormat.documentation: The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

OutputS3BucketName.documentation: Amazon S3 bucket name to which the output file will be saved.

OutputS3KeyPrefix.zonbookDocumentation: <para>The Amazon S3 key prefix for the output speech file.</para>
OutputS3KeyPrefix.documentation: The Amazon S3 key prefix for the output speech file.

SampleRate.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>The audio frequency specified in Hz.</para>
         <para>The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The 
      default value is "22050".</para>
         <para>Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000". </para>

The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".

Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation: Optional language code for the Speech Synthesis request. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN). If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

StartSpeechSynthesisTask.documentation: Allows the creation of an asynchronous synthesis task, by starting a new SpeechSynthesisTask. This operation requires all the standard information needed for speech synthesis, plus the name of an Amazon S3 bucket for the service to store the output of the synthesis task and two optional parameters (OutputS3KeyPrefix and SnsTopicArn). Once the synthesis task is created, this operation will return a SpeechSynthesisTask object, which will include an identifier of this task as well as the current status.

GetSpeechSynthesisTask.documentation: Retrieves a specific SpeechSynthesisTask object based on its TaskID. This object contains information about the given speech synthesis task, including the status of the task, and a link to the S3 bucket containing the output of the task.

NextToken.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>An opaque pagination token returned from the previous List operation 
      in this request. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.</para>
NextToken.documentation: An opaque pagination token returned from the previous List operation in this request. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.

SynthesisTasks.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>List of SynthesisTask objects that provides information from the specified task in the list request, 
      including output format, creation time, task status, and so on.</para>
SynthesisTasks.documentation: List of SynthesisTask objects that provides information from the specified task in the list request, including output format, creation time, task status, and so on.

TaskId.zonbookDocumentation: <para>The Amazon Polly generated identifier for a speech synthesis task.</para>
TaskId.documentation: The Amazon Polly generated identifier for a speech synthesis task.

TaskStatus.zonbookDocumentation: <para>Current status of the individual speech synthesis task.</para>
TaskStatus.documentation: Current status of the individual speech synthesis task.

TaskStatusReason.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>Reason for the current status of a specific speech synthesis task, including 
      errors if the task has failed.</para>
TaskStatusReason.documentation: Reason for the current status of a specific speech synthesis task, including errors if the task has failed.

CreationTime.zonbookDocumentation: <para>Timestamp for the time the synthesis task was started.</para>
CreationTime.documentation: Timestamp for the time the synthesis task was started.

SnsTopicArn.zonbookDocumentation: <para>ARN for the SNS topic optionally used for providing status notification for a speech synthesis task.</para>
SnsTopicArn.documentation: ARN for the SNS topic optionally used for providing status notification for a speech synthesis task.

LexiconNames.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service 
      to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language 
      of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. </para>
LexiconNames.documentation: List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice.

OutputFormat.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For 
      audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech
      marks, this will be json. </para>
OutputFormat.documentation: The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

SampleRate.zonbookDocumentation:
<para>The audio frequency specified in Hz.</para>
         <para>The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The 
      default value is "22050".</para>
         <para>Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000". </para>
SampleRate.documentation:
The audio frequency specified in Hz.

The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".

Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

SpeechMarkTypes.zonbookDocumentation: <para>The type of speech marks returned for the input text.</para>
SpeechMarkTypes.documentation: The type of speech marks returned for the input text.

TextType.zonbookDocumentation: <para>Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text. </para>
TextType.documentation: Specifies whether the input text is plain text or SSML. The default value is plain text.

VoiceId.zonbookDocumentation: <para>Voice ID to use for the synthesis. </para>
VoiceId.documentation: Voice ID to use for the synthesis.

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation: Optional language code for a synthesis task. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN). If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.
LanguageCode.documentation:
Optional language code for a synthesis task. This is only necessary if using a bilingual voice, such as Aditi, which can be used for either Indian English (en-IN) or Hindi (hi-IN).

If a bilingual voice is used and no language code is specified, Amazon Polly will use the default language of the bilingual voice. The default language for any voice is the one returned by the DescribeVoices operation for the LanguageCode parameter. For example, if no language code is specified, Aditi will use Indian English rather than Hindi.

members.zonbookDocumentation: <para>SynthesisTask object that provides information about a speech synthesis task.</para>
members.documentation: SynthesisTask object that provides information about a speech synthesis task.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The NextToken is invalid.
      Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The NextToken is invalid. Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

ListSpeechSynthesisTasks.documentation: Returns a list of SpeechSynthesisTask objects ordered by their creation date. This operation can filter the tasks by their status, for example, allowing users to list only tasks that are completed.

DescribeVoices.name: DescribeVoices

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>
      
      The language identification tag (ISO 639 code for the language name-ISO 3166 country code) 
      for filtering the list of voices returned. 
    If you don't specify this optional parameter, all available voices are returned.
    </simpara>
LanguageCode.documentation: The language identification tag (ISO 639 code for the language name-ISO 3166 country code) for filtering the list of voices returned. If you don't specify this optional parameter, all available voices are returned.

IncludeAdditionalLanguageCodes.zonbookDocumentation: Boolean value indicating whether to return any bilingual voices that use the specified language as an additional language. For instance, if you request all languages that use US English (es-US), and there is an Italian voice that speaks both Italian (it-IT) and US English, that voice will be included if you specify yes but not if you specify no.
IncludeAdditionalLanguageCodes.documentation: Boolean value indicating whether to return any bilingual voices that use the specified language as an additional language. For instance, if you request all languages that use US English (es-US), and there is an Italian voice that speaks both Italian (it-IT) and US English, that voice will be included if you specify yes but not if you specify no.

NextToken.zonbookDocumentation: An opaque pagination token returned from the previous DescribeVoices operation. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.
NextToken.documentation: An opaque pagination token returned from the previous DescribeVoices operation. If present, this indicates where to continue the listing.

Voices.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>A list of voices with their properties.</simpara>
Voices.documentation: A list of voices with their properties.

Id.zonbookDocumentation: Amazon Polly assigned voice ID. This is the ID that you specify when calling the SynthesizeSpeech operation.
Id.documentation: Amazon Polly assigned voice ID. This is the ID that you specify when calling the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

LanguageName.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Human readable name of the language in English.</simpara>
LanguageName.documentation: Human readable name of the language in English.

Name.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Name of the voice (for example, Salli, Kendra, etc.).
      This provides a human readable voice name that you might display 
    in your application.</simpara>
Name.documentation: Name of the voice (for example, Salli, Kendra, etc.). This provides a human readable voice name that you might display in your application.

AdditionalLanguageCodes.zonbookDocumentation: Additional codes for languages available for the specified voice in addition to its default language. For example, the default language for Aditi is Indian English (en-IN) because it was first used for that language. Since Aditi is bilingual and fluent in both Indian English and Hindi, this parameter would show the code hi-IN.
AdditionalLanguageCodes.documentation:
Additional codes for languages available for the specified voice in addition to its default language.

For example, the default language for Aditi is Indian English (en-IN) because it was first used for that language. Since Aditi is bilingual and fluent in both Indian English and Hindi, this parameter would show the code hi-IN.

NextToken.zonbookDocumentation: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of voices. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.
NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of voices. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The NextToken is invalid.
      Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The NextToken is invalid. Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

DescribeVoices.documentation:
Returns the list of voices that are available for use when requesting speech synthesis. Each voice speaks a specified language, is either male or female, and is identified by an ID, which is the ASCII version of the voice name.

When synthesizing speech ( SynthesizeSpeech ), you provide the voice ID for the voice you want from the list of voices returned by DescribeVoices.

For example, you want your news reader application to read news in a specific language, but giving a user the option to choose the voice. Using the DescribeVoices operation you can provide the user with a list of available voices to select from.

You can optionally specify a language code to filter the available voices. For example, if you specify en-US, the operation returns a list of all available US English voices.

This operation requires permissions to perform the polly:DescribeVoices action.

DeleteLexicon.name: DeleteLexicon

Name.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The name of the lexicon to delete. 
      Must be an existing lexicon in the region.</simpara>
Name.documentation: The name of the lexicon to delete. Must be an existing lexicon in the region.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon.
      This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon
      that is in a different region.</simpara>
         <simpara>Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see <xref linkend="ListLexicons"/>) 
      and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.

Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

DeleteLexicon.documentation:
Deletes the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. A lexicon which has been deleted is not available for speech synthesis, nor is it possible to retrieve it using either the GetLexicon or ListLexicon APIs.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

GetLexicon.name: GetLexicon

Content.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Lexicon content in string format.
      The content of a lexicon must be in PLS format.</simpara>
Content.documentation: Lexicon content in string format. The content of a lexicon must be in PLS format.

Lexicon.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Lexicon object that provides name and the string content of the 
    lexicon. </simpara>
Lexicon.documentation: Lexicon object that provides name and the string content of the lexicon.

Alphabet.zonbookDocumentation: Phonetic alphabet used in the lexicon. Valid values are ipa and x-sampa.
Alphabet.documentation: Phonetic alphabet used in the lexicon. Valid values are ipa and x-sampa.

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Language code that the lexicon applies to.
      A lexicon with a language code such as "en" would be
      applied to all English languages (en-GB, en-US, en-AUS,
      en-WLS, and so on.</simpara>
LanguageCode.documentation: Language code that the lexicon applies to. A lexicon with a language code such as "en" would be applied to all English languages (en-GB, en-US, en-AUS, en-WLS, and so on.

LastModified.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Date lexicon was last modified (a timestamp value).</simpara>
LastModified.documentation: Date lexicon was last modified (a timestamp value).

Size.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Total size of the lexicon, in characters.</simpara>
Size.documentation: Total size of the lexicon, in characters.

LexiconAttributes.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Metadata of the lexicon, including phonetic alphabetic used, language code, 
    lexicon ARN, number of lexemes defined in the lexicon, and size of lexicon in bytes.</simpara>
LexiconAttributes.documentation: Metadata of the lexicon, including phonetic alphabetic used, language code, lexicon ARN, number of lexemes defined in the lexicon, and size of lexicon in bytes.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon.
      This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon
      that is in a different region.</simpara>
         <simpara>Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see <xref linkend="ListLexicons"/>) 
      and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.

Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

GetLexicon.documentation: Returns the content of the specified pronunciation lexicon stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

NextToken.zonbookDocumentation: An opaque pagination token returned from previous ListLexicons operation. If present, indicates where to continue the list of lexicons.
NextToken.documentation: An opaque pagination token returned from previous ListLexicons operation. If present, indicates where to continue the list of lexicons.

Lexicons.documentation: A list of lexicon names and attributes.

Alphabet.zonbookDocumentation: Phonetic alphabet used in the lexicon. Valid values are ipa and x-sampa.

LanguageCode.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Language code that the lexicon applies to.
      A lexicon with a language code such as "en" would be
      applied to all English languages (en-GB, en-US, en-AUS,
      en-WLS, and so on.</simpara>

LastModified.documentation: Date lexicon was last modified (a timestamp value).

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token to use in the next request to continue the listing of lexicons. NextToken is returned only if the response is truncated.

      Verify that it's spelled correctly, and then try again.</simpara>

errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

ListLexicons.documentation: Returns a list of pronunciation lexicons stored in an AWS Region. For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

PutLexicon.name: PutLexicon

Name.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Name of the lexicon. The name must follow the regular express format 
      [0-9A-Za-z]{1,20}.
      That is, the name is a case-sensitive alphanumeric string up to 20 characters long.
    </simpara>
Name.documentation: Name of the lexicon. The name must follow the regular express format [0-9A-Za-z]{1,20}. That is, the name is a case-sensitive alphanumeric string up to 20 characters long.

Content.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Content of the PLS lexicon as string data.</simpara>
Content.documentation: Content of the PLS lexicon as string data.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon.
      Verify that the lexicon's name is spelled correctly, and then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation: Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. Verify that the lexicon's name is spelled correctly, and then try again.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: The alphabet specified by the lexicon is not a supported alphabet. Valid values are x-sampa and ipa.
errors.documentation: The alphabet specified by the lexicon is not a supported alphabet. Valid values are x-sampa and ipa.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The language specified in the lexicon is unsupported. For a list of 
      supported languages, see <ulink url="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/polly/latest/dg/API_LexiconAttributes.html">Lexicon Attributes</ulink>.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The language specified in the lexicon is unsupported. For a list of supported languages, see Lexicon Attributes.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The maximum size of the specified lexicon would be exceeded by this operation.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The maximum size of the specified lexicon would be exceeded by this operation.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The maximum size of the lexeme would be exceeded by this operation.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The maximum size of the lexeme would be exceeded by this operation.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The maximum number of lexicons would be exceeded by this operation.</simpara>
errors.documentation: The maximum number of lexicons would be exceeded by this operation.

errors.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>An unknown condition has caused a service failure.</simpara>
errors.documentation: An unknown condition has caused a service failure.

PutLexicon.documentation:
Stores a pronunciation lexicon in an AWS Region. If a lexicon with the same name already exists in the region, it is overwritten by the new lexicon. Lexicon operations have eventual consistency, therefore, it might take some time before the lexicon is available to the SynthesizeSpeech operation.

For more information, see Managing Lexicons.

      Verify that the lexicon's name is spelled correctly, and then try again.</simpara>

ContentType.zonbookDocumentation: Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request. If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg. If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg. If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format. If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.
ContentType.documentation:
Specifies the type audio stream. This should reflect the OutputFormat parameter in your request.

  • If you request mp3 as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/mpeg.

  • If you request ogg_vorbis as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/ogg.

  • If you request pcm as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/pcm in a signed 16-bit, 1 channel (mono), little-endian format.

  • If you request json as the OutputFormat, the ContentType returned is audio/json.

errors.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon.
      This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon
      that is in a different region.</simpara>
         <simpara>Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see <xref linkend="ListLexicons"/>) 
      and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.</simpara>
errors.documentation:
Amazon Polly can't find the specified lexicon. This could be caused by a lexicon that is missing, its name is misspelled or specifying a lexicon that is in a different region.

Verify that the lexicon exists, is in the region (see ListLexicons) and that you spelled its name is spelled correctly. Then try again.
